topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a04d15636872564aa40500#post_54a04d15636872564aa40500

People who have never read different thought currents are easy to impress, that and getaway series end up like that because that's what they are meant to be, the introduction of someone to a specific genre they have never seen before and profitable enough so that it gets the same effect to a wider.

True, sometimes this devolves into pleasing the lowest common denominators more times than none but that's usually one of the consequences of having a work widely recognized like EVA is.
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a0527963687259f2fa0200#post_54a0527963687259f2fa0200

That's *+what I personally+* consider a problem, what many call "The comfort zone"

Many saying I stay with this or this because is what I know and these other stuff is too complicated or something like that.

Maybe on the short term is not only acceptable but even encouraged, get used to a medium or area, get experience from that and then you can jump into the other, have a progression meter of sorts to broaden your perspective and have a much more focused opinion.

That's not the case on a practical level, most of the time it devolves into a safety blanket to go to an extreme side, rather than being something you end up coming back to because you genuinely like it and you think there's more to that genre or area you keep close to the chest.

Yes, not everyone likes that and some do it out of necessity (in the case of working experiences) or the recent exposure to new things (videogames, movies, etc.) has left them the opposite taste, but it is also truth that going and sticking to just one side of the road ends up closing many gates that would otherwise be the one many have been looking and aiming for.
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a055616368725f06270300#post_54a055616368725f06270300
Personally my tastes in media would have to be I absolutely hate series that are dumbed down.  Once in a while I do occasionally like dumb series, but 99% of the time if it's something that a five year old could do better then chances are I'll hate it.

If I had to make a list of my top favorite movies it would have to be 2001 A Space Odyssey, Pursuit of Happiness, Inception, Eternal Sunshine of a Spotless mind and movies like that.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a059f56368725ebba20a00#post_54a059f56368725ebba20a00

I know, dumb fun but that doesn't insult your intelligence (Pacific Rim  and Guardians of the Galaxy come to mind)

Being a copycat here and just for poor contrast, my top would be My Neighbour Totoro, Mask of Zorro, Fear and Loathing in las Vegas, The Perfect Dictatorship and pretty much anything from Tarantino.
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a05bc16368725759e40500#post_54a05bc16368725759e40500
I totally agree here; dumb fun can be good; I just don't like dumb fun that insults your intelligence.  If a movie or such treats the watcher like they're a idiot that definitely turns me off.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a05c3d63687252dd960500#post_54a05c3d63687252dd960500

I'm probably stepping on some toes, but every movie Shyamalan did falls into that category for me.

Yes, even Sixth Sense and Unbreakable I thought they had a good story behind, but the delivery of several lines ended up being too pretentious for my taste, like they were saying "It's gonna go over everyone's heads so we better water it down".

topics.body:
"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a05e4463687253ea2e0600#post_54a05e4463687253ea2e0600
I'm left wing cause I'm a technocrat and technocrats tend to be left wing.


Summary of my political beliefs: the majority of problems with the government are because of human error so replace the majority of them with computers and machines.

Basically what I mean by this is that rather than have say congress determine the budget instead have a resource allocation program determine the budget and where the money goes instead, because the main problem with congress right now is that a large portion of congress allocates the budget according to who they are buddies with rather than actual need.  What I mean by this is that say a congress member is business owner and is friends with another business owner that owns a company that makes roads; that congress member is far more likely to allocate governmental resources to his friend's company on the basis of them knowing him instead.
